data.title: 14 Notable Phones and Tablets from Mobile World Congress 2012
data.meta_description: Quad-core phones, slim tablets and gimmicky features abound at the 2012 Mobile World Congress. Here's a roundup of the most interesting smartphones and tablets from the show.
data.text:
Tech Specs: 4-inch TFT display with 960-by-540 resolution, 1 GHz dual-core processor, 8-megapixel rear camera, VGA front camera, 1 GB ram, 16 GB of storage, Android 2.3.

Why It’s Noteworthy: The Xperia P will debut Sony’s so-called “WhiteMagic” display technology, which stays legible in bright sunlight while managing screen brightness automatically to conserve battery life. It can also connect to a TV docking station (pictured), allowing access to phone content through any TV remote control.

Availability: On sale in the second quarter of this year.

(MORE: Sony Ericsson Xperia X10 Android Phone Coming to AT&T)
